alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Somerset (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 9:13PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Somerset and southwestern Worcester Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 913 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, moving southeast at 25 mph. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. While a tornado is not immediately likely, remain alert for any warnings. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, Princess Anne, University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, West Pocomoke, Whitehaven, Widgeon, Mount Vernon, Cokesbury, Allen, Whitesburg and Eden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
